subject: Rowing
lead_paragraph: A 14-member British-Irish rowing crew set a record for rowing across the Atlantic on Thursday, when they landed in Barbados 33 days 7 hours 30 minutes after it left the Canary Islands. During the 3,000-mile crossing, its boat, La Mondiale, also became the first ocean rowing boat to travel more than 100 miles a day for nine consecutive days, according to the Ocean Rowing Society International. The crew beat the previous record — set by the same French rowboat in 1992 — by more than two days.
